alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:24PM EST until January 10 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Chester Creek Near Chester affecting Delaware County. For the Chester Creek...including Chester...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chester Creek near Chester. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The creek floods adjacent open land. At 10.5 feet, Flood damage, adjacent to the creek, begins in the city of Chester. At 11.5 feet, Parker and Kerlin Streets flood. The 600 to 1300 blocks of Parker Street are subject to evacuations. The 1300-1400 blocks of Kerlin Street are also subject to evacuations. At 12.5 feet, The Parker Manor section of Chester is subject to evacuations. At 13.0 feet, Chester Creek Road floods in Brookhaven Borough. Closures are possible between Dutton Mill Road and Bridgewater Road. Mt. Alverno Road between Middletown and Aston is closed due to flooding. At 14.0 feet, Chester Creek Road near West Knowlton Road floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:16 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 8.0 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:16 PM EST Tuesday was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 13.0 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 2.9 feet and begin rising again tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 3.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall to 2.9 feet and begin rising again late tomorrow evening. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 04/02/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Chester Creek Chester 8.0 8.0 Tue 7 pm 3.1 MSG 13.0 9pm 1/09 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 730 AM EST.
